tool.name: TN93
tool.command: tn93 -o '$tn93_distances' #if str($options.advanced) == 'advanced': -t $options.threshold -a $options.ambigs -g $options.fraction -f csv -l $options.overlap #if $options.counts_in_name: -d '$options.counts_in_name' #end if #end if #if $second_fasta: -s '$second_fasta' #end if '$input_fasta'

param.name: second_fasta
param.label: Additional input FASTA for pairwise comparisons

param.name: threshold
param.label: Only report distances below this threshold

param.name: fraction
param.label: Maximum tolerated fraction of ambiguous characters

param.name: overlap
param.label: Only count pairs that overlap by at least N bases

param.name: counts_in_name
param.label: Sequence name component immediately preceding a copy number

tool.help:
TN93 ----
Compute pairwise distances between aligned nucleotide sequences in sequential FASTA format using the [Tamura Nei 93 distance](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/8336541).
NOTES -----
All sequences must be aligned and have the same length. Only IUPAC characters are recognized (e.g. no ~). Sequence names can include copy number as in
>seqname:10
':' can be replaced with another character using `-d`, and sequences that have no explicit copy number are assumed to be a single copy. Copy numbers only affect histogram and mean calculations.
